title: INtopBackup
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Trump says U.S. will resume sending weapons to Ukraine after pausing last week
items.description: With Russian attacks escalating, Ukraine is dependent on air defense systems and munitions supplied by western allies to protect Ukrainian cities.

items.title: IRS says churches can now endorse political candidates
items.description: Since 1954, an IRS rule had barred houses of worship from explicitly endorsing political candidates.

items.title: A Planet Money guide to 5 fascinating new econ papers
items.description: The Planet Money newsletter rounds up some new economics studies.

items.title: How to help Texas flood survivors. And, health organizations sue RFK Jr.
items.description: Search efforts are still ongoing after the deadly Texas floods. Here's how you can help survivors. And RFK Jr.'s vaccine policy has sparked a lawsuit.

items.title: With Indus Waters Treaty in the balance, Pakistan braces for more water woes
items.description: In an unprecedented move, India held the water treaty in abeyance after blaming Pakistan for a deadly attack in April. Pakistan denies involvement in ...

items.title: Acropolis closes as heatwave grips Greece
items.description: The popular Athens attraction is shutting temporarily as highs of 42C are forecast for parts of the country.

items.title: Trump upbeat on Gaza ceasefire talks despite lack of breakthrough
items.description: The US president said talk were going "very well", but a Palestinian source tells the BBC they have not made headway.

items.title: Intense downpours like those in Texas are more frequent, but there’s no telling where they’ll happen
Israeli defence minister plans to move Gaza's population to camp in Rafah
items.description: Israel Katz tells Israeli media the so-called "humanitarian city" in Rafah will eventually house 2.1 million Palestinians.

items.title: 7/8: CBS Morning News
items.description: Texas flash floods kill at least 104, with dozens still missing; Amazon deploys its one millionth robot.

items.title: Bee attack injures several dozen in France
items.description: Twenty-four people were stung, with a witness describing how "very panicked people" tried to bat off the bees.

items.title: 'Hero' dad, twin girls and riverside campers among Texas flood victims

items.description: Hope of finding survivors of the catastrophic flooding in Texas is dimming a day after the death toll surpassed 100.

items.description: Dozens of people have died in the Texas flooding that struck on the Fourth of July.
